intro: Asterostoma multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered asterostoma, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces numerous small, tubular flowers arranged in a flat, open cluster, typically in shades of yellow or orange. Its leaves are usually alternate, simple, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Asterostoma multiflora is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
